Dialogue.NPCText:
The figure before you is draped in a swirling mantle of dusk—a Cowl of Vanished Voices drawn low, hiding sharp eyes and a lipless, silent mouth.
His presence feels wrong, as if the air itself forgets your words.

Olfric inclines his head in mute greeting, gestures invitingly with a gloved hand.

(He cannot speak aloud, but his eyes search yours with an intensity that demands understanding.)

Option.text: Attempt to break the silence by speaking.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Olfric touches the edge of his hood, then gestures to his throat, miming the act of plucking music from the air and casting it away.
He produces a tiny, rune-carved harp, its strings broken. A gesture—a memory of song lost.

He unrolls a piece of parchment, written in a precise hand:
"Once, I sang for warmth in the firelight—bard to warlord, lover, and liar. Now, my voice is a stolen thing. They call me Whispercloak.
Aerilon sends me secrets. Buccaneer's Den hunts my shadow. Here, I walk in silence."

Option.text: Ask about his cloak and odd garments.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Olfric’s eyes flicker with approval. He withdraws a thin, dagger-like blade—Murderer’s Soliloquy—and holds it flat in his palm, before vanishing it beneath his Muffling Jacket.
He studies your posture, weighing your intentions.

Option.text: Sign: 'Is there work for a skilled hand?'
Breathe in the quiet, wait for him to move first.

Dialogue.NPCText:
You try to speak, but your words seem swallowed by the air. Olfric gestures apologetically, tracing a rune in the air—a sign of his curse.
A shimmer runs across his Echo-Drinker Cloak, and you hear the faintest echo of your own voice—muffled, hollow, gone.
You sense this is not malicious, but a burden he cannot shake.

Option.text: Sign: 'I can help. What troubles you?'
Step away from the unnatural silence.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Olfric shrugs, then taps a symbol on his cloak—the glyph of the Obelisk of Veyra.
He sketches a rough map on the ground, showing lines (routes) from Aerilon, Buccaneer’s Den, and Wind all converging here.
He holds up one finger, then points to you, then to the icy heart of town.
He is here to watch, to warn, perhaps to find someone who listens.

Olfric’s gaze grows grave. He produces a scrap of parchment, scrawled with icy runes:
"Minax whispers in every shadow. Not all enemies wear her mark. One among your elders is already lost. The Executioner stalks at her call."
He gives a sidelong glance towards the Obelisk’s direction, then places a gloved finger over his lips, urging secrecy.

Olfric shakes his head sharply. He tears the parchment, scatters it to the wind.
With his Whisperthief’s Gloves, he draws a symbol in the snow—a circle with a single break.
Trust is broken. He will not reveal the traitor… not yet.

Option.text: Let it go, offer your aid instead.

Dialogue.NPCText:
His expression darkens. He makes the sign for “wait,” then turns away for a moment, composing himself.
Olfric is not ready to share this secret. Trust must be earned through action.

He draws a quick set of marks in the snow: a blade (Bryndra), a bottle (Lira), an eye (Irinya), and a burning candle (Kaelen).
Olfric places his hand over the “eye”—trusts Irinya most.
Then a question mark beside the blade—unsure of Bryndra.
He trusts few, and always with caution.

Olfric lets you study his garments:
Cowl of Vanished Voices (a shroud said to silence any who wear it).
Muffling Jacket (leather, stitched with Aerilon runes for quiet movement).
Sable Hakama (breeze-cold, seems to leave no tracks in snow).
Whisperthief’s Gloves (fingers etched for lockpicking, never squeak).
Silent Step Tabi (soles padded with cloudfox fur, nearly invisible in frost).
Echo-Drinker Cloak (absorbs sound, shimmers with lost voices).
Murderer’s Soliloquy (a thin, rune-carved spike with a musical motif).
Each piece is a tool—earned, stolen, or traded in silence.

He bows his head, pleased, and offers you a small woven token—a silent blessing.
Perhaps this is how he rewards respect.

Option.text: Accept token, offer help in return.

Dialogue.NPCText: <BASEFONT COLOR='#aacdd1'> Olfric is content to let the silence linger. After a long pause, he gestures toward the north gates, then points at you, then at his heart—signaling that only action earns words. </BASEFONT>

Olfric produces a scrap of parchment, hastily sketched:
"Glacial Executioner—a spirit of ice and hate, stalking the outskirts. Once a hunter, now a butcher. Marked by the Obelisk's corruption.
Killed two of Svala's kin. Feeds on voices, grows stronger by night.
Hunt it. Bring its frost-bitten helm as proof.
I will reward silence with secrets."
He holds your gaze, and you sense his urgency.
Frostmere will not rest while the Executioner walks the wilds.

Option.text: I will hunt the Glacial Executioner for you.
How did you lose your own voice?
This is too dangerous for me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Olfric’s eyes shine with a glimmer of hope. He sketches a map—Executioner lairs in the glacier chasm northeast, near the ruined shrines. Beware its icy howl.
He presses a cold, rune-marked token into your palm—perhaps it will protect you from the worst of the spirit’s curse.

Option.text: I will return with proof of its end.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Olfric makes a cutting motion across his throat, then covers his mouth.
He writes:
"Victims left mute. Some never wake. It grows stronger each voice it takes. The Obelisk twists fate, and so do those who serve it."

Option.text: This is unsettling... but I'll try.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Olfric opens a pouch and shows rare items—crystals that dampen sound, a ring that repels chill, and a scrap of forbidden sheet music.
He writes:
"Your reward is choice—protection, knowledge, or a song from the past. You will choose when you return."

Option.text: That's worth the risk. I'm in.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He closes his eyes, touching the Cowl of Vanished Voices.
He writes:
"Cursed for slaying the wrong man. Warlord's dying breath stole my song—left me to live in silence. Now I silence only the guilty."
A shadow of regret passes over his face.

Olfric raises a brow, surprised by your interest. He slowly lowers his hood, revealing hollow cheekbones and an old scar that curves beneath his jaw.
He pulls a parchment from within his jacket, scrawled in sharp calligraphy:

"Once, I was a bard in Britain’s twilight. My songs stirred hearts and silenced blades. I loved a woman of Wind, betrayed a lord of Buccaneer's Den, and paid the price with silence."
"Would you still hear more?"

Option.text: Yes. Tell me about the woman from Wind.
Tell me about your bard days.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Olfric’s expression softens. He sketches a rune in the snow—a spiraling glyph known in Wind as the symbol for “binding.”

He writes:
"Her name was Elayne. A chronomancer who sang with time as I sang with lute. We made music no court could bear. She vanished the day the rift opened, chasing Minax's shadow into another shard."
"I seek her still."

Option.text: I'll look for signs of her, if I can.
She’s likely gone. You should let go.
That’s tragic. What of your songs?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Olfric’s eyes narrow. He draws a slash through the glyph and turns away momentarily.
He is silent for longer than usual. Perhaps your words struck too deep.

Option.text: You loved her. I see that now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He gently removes a shard of wood from his cloak—it’s all that remains of a lute.
A strange hush falls over the air.
He writes:
"I was court bard to Lord Wyrthe in Magincia. Songs of rebellion. Songs of secrets. I played to sway kings and disarm killers. My greatest song made a murderer weep."
"But it was also what painted the mark on me. Aerilon found value in silence."

Option.text: Play a song again, even silently.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Olfric plucks invisible strings. Though no sound is heard, a strange echo trembles in your chest—like memory, or sorrow.
You feel... lighter somehow.
(You gain a momentary sense of calm.)

Option.text: That was... something. Tell me about Aerilon.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He unsheathes Murderer’s Soliloquy, showing a single glyph on its edge: the sigil of the High Warlord of Buccaneer’s Den.
Then he writes:
"I sang the warlord’s secrets to his enemies. He died that night, as planned. But his final curse clung to me."
"Now, Aerilon sends me where words must die."

Option.text: Aerilon uses you like a tool.
I’ve done things I regret too.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Olfric bows his head.
He writes:
"Assassin. Watcher. Mute shadow. I carry death, yes—but I also carry warning."
"If Minax wins, none of us will have voices left to sing."

Option.text: You still have purpose. I believe in that.
Better than rotting in chains, I suppose.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Olfric gives a subtle shrug.
He writes:
"I am a scalpel, yes. But I choose my incisions."
"And one day, I may carve Aerilon from the sky."

Option.text: Let me help you one day.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Olfric nods once, pulling his cowl back over his face.
He leaves you with one final note, placed gently into your palm:
"Truth weighs nothing, but burdens all. If you still wish to walk beside it, return with silence, not questions."
